page.title: 14Changing Times In Kidsgrove
page.content: We interviewed Mrs.Griffiths who has lived in Kidsgrove for the last 60 years.She told us that during that time Kidsgrove had grown greatly in area. There used to be many more shops in Kidsgrove selling a wide variety of things,but now people shop more in Hanley or Newcastle. Most of the people who lived in Kidsgrove when Mrs.Griffiths was young worked in the coal mines in Kidsgrove or the pot-banks in Burslem or Tunstall. When Mrs.Griffiths was young there were two railway stations in Kidsgrove- one line went to Stoke and the other went to Hanley.The canal which goes right through the centre of the town was much busier than it is now.There weren't as many cars or buses as there are now.People would walk more.They walked to Hanley,Crewe or Congleton.
